title.narrative: F.a: Stregthening the quality of education in Uganda's education sector

description.narrative: 1. Project: 11682 Strengthening the Quality of Education in Uganda Education Sector#2. Project area and Country: Lyantonde district, Uganda#3. Project justification: #A study by UWEZO 2016 shows that from P3-P7, only 3 out of 10 pupils could read and under stand an English story. In rural areas, only 35% of the children achieved literacy and numeracy competencies. The study also found out that 39% of the teachers were consistently absent from school. The new Uganda Service Delivery Indicators (SDI)based on i ndependent surveys of 5,300 teachers in 400 primary schools show that Ugandas schools still struggle with the quality of teaching. A key Uganda SDI finding was that only 1 in 5 teachers master the curriculum they teach. Unlike many new districts created un der the decentralised framework, Lyantonde district still grapples with challenges, such as high levels of poverty, a high HIV+AIDS prevalence leading to high number of orphans and a poor capacity of the community structures. This has led to poor service d elivery across all sectors and especially in education, denying many children in Lyantonde their right to quality education. #4. The main objective and expected results:#The main objective of the project is to strengthen the capacity of citizens (parents, pupils and civil society organizations) to foster increased collaboration with duty bearers for improved quality of education in Lyantonde district. This will be accomplished through the promotion of child friendly school environments, building the capacit y of parents and school/PTA management committees to effectively participate in and monitor the delivery of education services, and through the promotion of dialogue between the rights holders and duty bearers. The project will also work to strengthen the institutional capacity of RACOBAO to promote quality education. #5. Right-holders/ beneficiaries: 7418 children#Duty bearers: Lyantonde District Leadership (District Education Officer, Chief Administrative Officer) and religious and opinion leaders #6. Implementing partner: Rural Action Community Based Organisation (RACOBAO)
